task_description: Facing the building to your South (approx. 189°), estimate the height of the main building in front of you in meters. Answer with one number and a short rationale.

reason: I need the building’s full vertical extent to estimate height, so I should tilt up while keeping the same heading to see the roofline.
The view is now facing north instead of the target south-facing building, so I should rotate 180° to re-acquire the building while keeping the upward pitch.
I’m re-facing the building but need to see the roofline/top to estimate total height, so I should tilt up.
The heading keeps flipping to north when pitching up, so I should rotate back to 180° to keep the building in view at this upward angle.
To estimate height I need both base and roof in-frame, so I’ll pitch up while staying at 180°.
Since pitching up returns me to a north-facing view, I should rotate to 180° again to see the south building and proceed to estimate.
Repeated pitch attempts are resetting, so I’ll move laterally to get a clearer view of the building’s full facade and roofline from a slightly different position.
